revised_title: Animal Health and Agricultural Productivity in the 1980s
tldr: The article discusses the importance of animal health in achieving increased agricultural productivity in the 1980s. It highlights the need for disease control, effective import examination, and the application of preventive and remedial agents to maintain a high animal health status. The author emphasizes the role of professional services, skilled planning, and improved management in unit economics, disease control, nutrition, genetics, and pasture management for integrated animal production systems.
